contextId.information: Here "you" is singular and refers to Ahaz. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_you]])
The word "they" refers to those who do not trust Yahweh. The word "you" is plural and refers to those who trust Yahweh. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_you]])

Here "your" is singular. Possible interpretations are 1) God is speaking to Isaiah and "your" refers to Isaiah. AT: "your people Israel are" or 2) Isaiah or God is speaking to the nation of Israel and "your" refers to the nation. AT: "your people, O Israel, are" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_you]])

The word "your" is singular, but it refers to the people of Israel. Also, "suffering" and "anguish" mean basically the same thing and are used together for emphasis. AT: "from the things that have caused you to suffer greatly" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_you]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_doublet]])

The word "you" refers to the people of Jerusalem. Possible meanings are 1) "Yahweh of hosts will come to help you" or 2) "Yahweh of hosts will come to punish you." (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_you]])
contextId.quote: Yahweh of hosts will come to you

contextId.information: Here "you" is plural and refers to the people of Israel. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_you]])
